tit.cmt: 共通用語リストでは「Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI」とありますが、ここでの振り仮名に合わせた「TOYOTOMI no Tsurumatsu」と併記します。以降固有名詞は共通用語リストに従いました。

sen.j: 豊臣 鶴松（とよとみの つるまつ）は、豊臣秀吉の長男（異説あり）。
sen.e: Tsurumatsu TOYOTOMI/ TOYOTOMI no Tsurumatsu (豊臣 鶴松) is the first son of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI (there is a different theory)

sen.j: 天正17年（1589年）5月27日、豊臣秀吉の長男として山城国の淀城で誕生する。
sen.e: On May 27, 1589, he was born as the first son of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI at Yodo-jo Castle in Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: このとき秀吉53歳という高齢であった。
sen.e: At that time Hideyoshi was already later in life at the age of 53.

sen.j: 実子を失っていた秀吉の晩年の子であったため、後継者として期待されるが、天正19年（1591年）閏1月に発病し、一旦は快復したものの、8月5日に大坂城にてわずか3歳で病死した。
sen.e: As he was a child that Hideyoshi had in his later years after having lost his birth child, he was expected to be the heir, however, in January 1591 (intercalary year) he became sick, and although he was recovered once, he died at Osaka-jo Castle on August 5, at the age of only 3.

sen.j: 秀吉の嘆きは大きく、京東山区に菩提寺「祥雲寺」（臨済宗）を建立した。
sen.e: Hideyoshi's grief was so deep that he constructed the family temple 'Shoun-ji' (Rinzai sect) at Higashiyama-ku Word, Kyoto.

sen.j: この寺は豊臣氏滅亡後、秀吉と対立していた根来寺の僧に与えられ、智積院（真言宗）となった。
sen.e: After the Toyotomi clan was destroyed, this temple was granted to the Buddhist monks who were opposed to Hideyoshi, and was converted into Chishakuin Temple (Shingon sect)

sen.j: 秀吉は鶴松の出生に喜び、生後4ヶ月で鶴松を大坂城に入れて後継者に指名したという。
sen.e: Hideyoshi was pleased with the birth of Tsurumatsu, and he invited Tsurumatsu to appoint him as his heir when he was only four months old.

sen.j: 生来蒲柳の質（つまり病弱）だったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that he was Horyu no Shitsu (poor in health) by nature

sen.j: 秀吉は鶴松の病気を快復させるため、曲直瀬玄朔ら天下の名医と呼ばれる医者を呼び集め、さらにポルトガルなど南蛮の医者まで呼び集めようとしたという。
sen.e: To recover the health of Tsurumatsu, it is said that Hideyoshi called up the medical doctors, who were supposed to be the best doctors at that time, including Gensaku MANASE, and even tried to invite western doctors including those from Portugal.
